Title: The Berenstain Bears: Bears Get a Babysitter!

reviewText: My 4 year old daughter loves these movies and the books. They always have a great message...especially "Count Your Blessings."
Title: The Berenstain Bears: Bears Get a Babysitter!

reviewText: This is quite the favorite in this house.  The babysitter turns out to be the widow whom Brother and Sister Bear tore through her garden chasing a baseball.  Instead of owning up to their mistake immediately, they keep it to themselves, and lose their ball.  The story progresses to Widow Bruin becoming their babysitter and how she gets them to reveal what they did.  It's just a great lesson on kindness on everyone's part and doing the right thing (Brother and Sister wind up LOVING Widow Bruin!). The rest of the stories are just excellent, all with wonderful morals to the stories, very valuable lessons.  Highly, highly recommend!
Title: The Berenstain Bears: Bears Get a Babysitter!

reviewText: Any Berenstain Bears DVD is a treat for my children.  They love them.  And we love the DVDs too.  They always have a good lesson and are very "clean" and appropriate for little ones.
Title: The Berenstain Bears: Bears Get a Babysitter!

reviewText: I was a huge BB fan when I was in elementary school. I had pretty much every single Berenstein Bear book and VHS tape produced up until about 1996. I have to agree with some reviewers that I preferred the voices in the old tapes to these new ones, but it's just matter of what you're used to. That being said, my 4 and 5 year old boys love the new version, and I love the morals/values they pick up from each episode.
Title: The Berenstain Bears: Bears Get a Babysitter!
